info.name: MarocExploreAPI
info.description:
## Authentification

L'API utilise l'authentification par jeton (token) pour sécuriser les routes nécessitant une authentification. Lors de l'inscription ou de la connexion, un jeton d'accès est généré et doit être utilisé pour accéder aux fonctionnalités protégées.

request.description: Permet à un nouvel utilisateur de s'inscrire.

header.name: cache-control
header.info:
Postman added "Cache-Control: no-cache" as a precautionary measure to prevent the server from returning stale response when one makes repeated requests.

You can remove this header in the app settings or enter a new one with a different value.

header.name: postman-token
header.info:
The Postman-Token header appends a random UUID to every outgoing request. Postman adds this header for API developers to better debug requests sent and to ensure separate requests appear distinct to the receiving server.

You can remove this header in the app settings.

header.name: content-type
header.info:
The Content-Type header is added to help the server identify the media type of the request body that is present in this request.

Use the request body tab to control the value or to remove this header.

header.name: content-length
header.info:
The Content-Length header was added to indicate to the server the size of the request body that is added to this request. Server uses this value to parse the request body accurately.

You can remove the header or enter a new one with a different value.

header.name: host
header.info:
The Host header is added to identify the domain name for which a request is being sent to the server. This header is implicitly sent by every HTTP client.

You can remove the header or enter a new one with a different value. It is most likely that without this header, your request will return an HTTP 400 error.

header.name: user-agent
header.info:
The User-Agent header is added to help the server identify Postman as the HTTP requesting application or client.

It is recommended that this header be sent, but you can remove the header or enter a new one with a different value.

header.name: accept
header.info:
The "Accept: */*" header is added to tell the server that Postman can understand and process all forms of response content types.

It is recommended that this header be sent, but you can remove the header or enter a new one with a different value.

header.name: accept-encoding
header.info:
The Accept-Encoding header is added to indicate to the server that Postman HTTP client supports a defined list of content-encoding or compression algorithms as response.

You can remove the header or enter a new one with a different value. Doing that may not accurately render the response within the app.

header.name: connection
header.info:
Postman added the Connection header to indicate the server to keep the underlying network connection open once the current response is received. This allows Postman to reuse the same connection for faster response times in subsequent requests to the same server.

You can remove this header or enter a new one with a different value, such as `Connection: Close` to control this behaviour.

request.description: Permet à un utilisateur existant de se connecter et de recevoir un jeton d'accès.

header.name: cookie
header.info:
The Cookie header is added to send the cookies that are associated with this endpoint.

Use the cookie manager to remove the header or to change the value.

header.name: cache-control
header.info:
Postman added "Cache-Control: no-cache" as a precautionary measure to prevent the server from returning stale response when one makes repeated requests.

You can remove this header in the app settings or enter a new one with a different value.

request.description: Permet à un utilisateur authentifié de modifier les détails d'un itinéraire existant, y compris le titre, la catégorie, la durée et l'image.
Permet à un utilisateur ou à un visiteur de visualiser tous les itinéraires disponibles sur la plateforme.
Permet à un utilisateur ou à un visiteur de rechercher des itinéraires en fonction de leur titre.
Permet à un utilisateur ou à un visiteur de filtrer les itinéraires selon des critères spécifiques tels que la catégorie ou la durée.

request.description: Permet à un utilisateur authentifié de se déconnecter de l'application et de terminer sa session en cours.
